eras.name: Early R&D Era
eras.description: Laboratory to Garage - University spinouts, modest federal R&D, first automotive attempts
eras.key_outcome: Proved technical feasibility but lacked scale and market demand

eras.name: First EV Wave
eras.description: Policy Push Meets Reality - $2.4B federal grants, startup boom, demand disappointment
eras.key_outcome: Revealed enormous capital and market development challenges

eras.name: Gigafactory Era
eras.description: Manufacturing Scale - Nevada Gigafactory, dramatic cost reductions, recycling emergence
eras.key_outcome: Proved gigascale manufacturing viability, drove 85% cost decline

eras.name: Policy-Driven Boom
eras.description: IRA-Catalyzed Expansion - $198B investment surge, self-sufficiency trajectory, BEV parity achieved
eras.key_outcome: US on path to battery self-sufficiency by 2030, EV cost parity achieved

events.significance: GM, Ford, Chrysler pool technical knowledge for EV battery development; DOE joins late 1991
events.impact: Created gov-industry partnership model; $189M Phase I funding split between DOE and automakers

events.significance: Yet-Ming Chiang, Bart Riley, Ric Fulop establish company based on MIT materials research
events.impact: Became poster child for early battery manufacturing; eventual bankruptcy showed risks

events.significance: A123's batteries chosen for DeWalt cordless tools
events.impact: First major commercial application; validated technology before EV pivot

events.significance: First highway-legal lithium-ion electric sports car prototypes shown in Santa Monica
events.impact: Proved lithium-ion viability for automotive; started Tesla's trajectory

events.significance: Federal funding under Bush Administration
events.impact: Early government support for battery tech; preceded larger Obama investments

events.significance: First lithium-ion EV enters production; delivered to Musk February 2008
events.impact: Demonstrated 245-mile range unprecedented for production EV; 6,831 cells in pack

events.significance: Obama's $787B stimulus includes massive clean energy investment
events.impact: Enabled $2.4B battery grants + DOE ATVM loans

events.significance: 48 projects receive funding; goal to create 30 factories producing 20% of world batteries
events.impact: Single largest battery investment ever; funded A123 ($249M), Johnson Controls, others

events.significance: Shares close at $20.29 on first day; company goes public
events.impact: Peak valuation before recall/bankruptcy; showed investor enthusiasm

events.significance: Loan for Model S development and powertrain facility
events.impact: Only success story from ATVM; repaid early 2013, 9 years ahead of schedule

events.significance: First U.S. automaker IPO since Ford (1956); raised $226M
events.impact: Shares surged 40.5% first day; $10K investment now worth ~$3M

events.significance: First mass-market EVs from major OEMs hit U.S. showrooms
events.impact: Mainstream EV era begins; slower adoption than expected hurt suppliers

events.significance: Battery maker with $118.5M DOE grant files bankruptcy; exits March 30, 2012
events.impact: Think Global investment ($73M writeoff) and slow EV demand cited

events.significance: $459.8M assets, $376M liabilities; had drawn $129M of $249M DOE grant
events.impact: MIT spinout's demise; acquired by Wanxiang (China) for $256.6M Jan 2013

events.significance: Full repayment 9 years ahead of schedule using $1B capital raise
events.impact: Proved DOE loan program could succeed; contrasts with Solyndra/Fisker

events.significance: $5B facility planned; Panasonic invests $1.5-2B in cell production
events.impact: Nevada site announced Sept 4, 2014; $1.287B state incentives

events.significance: First mainstream home battery storage (7/10 kWh models)
events.impact: 38,000 reservations in days; residential storage market ignited

events.significance: Industry 'easily beat' $200/kWh target that seemed far-fetched in 2012
events.impact: Continued 85% cost decline from 2010; accelerated EV adoption

events.event: Gigafactory 1 mass battery cell production begins
events.significance: Nevada facility operational; 2170 format cells at scale
events.impact: Largest battery factory globally; drove cost reductions

events.event: Redwood Materials founded by JB Straubel
events.significance: Tesla co-founder/CTO starts battery recycling company
events.impact: Addressed e-waste and materials supply; now $3.7B+ valuation

events.event: Battery pack costs: $140/kWh average; some e-bus packs <$100
events.significance: First instances below critical $100/kWh threshold (China e-buses)
events.impact: Historic milestone; EV cost parity approaching

events.significance: $6B+ for battery materials/manufacturing/recycling; $5B for grid demos
events.impact: $3B manufacturing grants, $3B materials processing, preceded IRA

events.event: Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) signed into law
events.significance: Section 45X: $35/kWh cells, $10/kWh modules. Section 48C: $10B investment credits
events.impact: Largest climate bill ever; triggered 686% battery investment increase Q2 2022-Q2 2024

events.event: Ford-CATL partnership announced: $3.5B Michigan LFP plant
events.significance: Ford owns 100%, licenses CATL tech; Marshall, MI; 2,500 jobs (later cut to 1,700)
events.impact: Political controversy over Chinese tech; scaled back Nov 2023

events.event: Battery pack costs: $115/kWh average; BEV packs $97/kWh
events.significance: 20% drop (largest since 2017); BEVs cross $100/kWh threshold first time
events.impact: Cost parity milestone achieved for BEVs; industry average nearly there

events.significance: Swedish battery maker ($12B valuation peak) files with $5.8B debt
events.impact: European champion fails; only 1 GWh vs 16 GWh target; $2B BMW contract lost
